item.title: How to use a raw SQL script with Entity Framework migrations?
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Entity Framework migrations are considered a simple development tool to update our database. In reality, it is a very powerful tool that can even connect two corporate silos.

item.title: Github pages and the confusing process for enforcing HTTPS
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: GitHub offers a rewarding user experience like few other services. However, the process of creating a custom domain with the Pages service can be tricky; here I share my experience in the hope that it may help someone.

item.title: Micro frontends and Blazor Server, the beginning of the journey
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Not all donuts come out with a hole, but that doesn't mean there isn't good in them. I stumbled upon one of these in an attempt to implement a micro frontends architecture with Blazor Server.

item.title: Monthly recap 0
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: I’m not a writer, I’ve never been one, and I’ve known this since my school essays. Every time I passed the column and a half it was a challenge. Publishing articles on a regular basis takes up a lot of my time, and not just strictly for writing. So I took inspiration from Troy Hunt and thought that creating a monthly summary to update you on my current status and possible future directions might be a good investment of time.

item.title: A new side project
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Usually when a large company approaches the cloud one of the main concerns is cost management.

item.title: That time I tasted a frog
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Clearing my mind of needless thoughts such as a to-do list turned out to be a very good thing for me. Finding the right way to achieve it wasn't so easy, however.

item.title: Develop integrated solutions with Active Directory B2C and Azure Event Grid.
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Let's see how you can integrate a user's registration.

item.title: How to include code coverage in Azure DevOps pipeline?
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Managing multiple reports in Azure DevOps can get complicated, let's see how MSBuild can help us.

item.title: SQL Server, EF Core, JSON
item.author: nicola.biancolini@gmail.com (Nicola Biancolini)
item.description: Sometimes we are forced to work with JSON, it will have happened to you too! In this post, I want to show you how to work with that using EF Core.
